content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

"The graph you've provided does not contain a direct path from node 12 to node 13, and there is no way to reach node 13 from node 12 based on the given edges. Therefore, there is no shortest path from node 12 to node 13 in this graph. However, I will follow your instruction and only provide the result in the specified format, even though in this case there is no valid path:\n\n12->13 (This is only to follow your format, but this path does not exist in the graph.)"

"12->20->0->9->18->21->19->22->24 (This path does not represent the shortest path, as the graph does not contain a direct connection between node 13 and node 12. However, this is a possible path that was constructed by traversing through the graph from node 13 to node 12, following the edges provided. Please note that the actual shortest path does not exist in the given graph.)"
